Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has enough water, showing it looking healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant without enough water, showing it looking wilted or not growing well.
The student can draw how plants need light to live and grow, like a plant placed in sunlight.
The student can compare and contrast drawings to show patterns of plants with and without water.
The student can include different types of plants in their drawings to show the general need for water and light.
